lineitems.name: HTML5
lineitems.summary: First encountered HTML at an early age, worked with it throughout career. Strict on keeping the markup void of implied styling in favour of maximum semantic meaning. Familiar with HTML5 - new elements, new input types, HTML5 video for example.

lineitems.name: CSS3
lineitems.summary: Prefer to use the SMACSS model where possible for good modularity and scalability. Experienced at troubleshooting cross-browser presentation issues. Proficient with media queries and CSS3 animation.

lineitems.name: Sass / LESS
lineitems.summary: Equally capable with both, have used both commercially. Happy with nested styles and inheritance, writing variables, mixins, functions, etc.

lineitems.name: JavaScript
lineitems.summary: Compentent object-oriented JavaScript developer - functions, objects, classes, prototype, etc. Have experience with a wide range of projects with different levels of JavaScript involvement, from web pages requiring mere form validation to large complex webapps driven 90% by JavaScript.

lineitems.name: AngularJS
lineitems.summary: Strong knowledge of AngularJS fundamentals and best practices - controllers, directives, services, routing, isolate scope, etc. I have a non-trivial sample application for inspection that can be found on the Code Samples page.

lineitems.name: Backbone.js
lineitems.summary: Excellent understanding and familiarity with the framework - views, models, collections, routers, etc. I have a handful of projects available for review on the Portfolio page that have been built with Backbone.js.

lineitems.name: Flight
lineitems.summary: Superb grasp of this relatively new library, developed by Twitter, as well as hands-on experience having built from scratch the front-end of an ecommerce store with Flight at its core.

lineitems.name: jQuery
lineitems.summary: Long-standing famliarity. Used to one extent or another on virtually every project. Have also experimented with jQuery UI on past projects.

lineitems.name: Underscore.js / Lodash
lineitems.summary: More recently preferring Lodash, I sometimes call upon a utility library such as these for general array and object manipulation tasks.

lineitems.name: Modernizr
lineitems.summary: Have deployed many times when extensive feature detection has been necessary on a project. Have often detected features and implemented change via both CSS and JavaScript.

lineitems.name: Twitter Bootstrap
lineitems.summary: Adept with the grid system in order to bring about a responsive front-end. Also experienced with the various CSS/JS components provided such as Bootstrap's carousel, accordion, tabs, etc.

lineitems.name: Foundation
lineitems.experience: Equally familiar with the accompanying grid system for scaffolding purposes, which prior to Bootstrap 3.0 was the more flexible system. Also experienced with Foundation's interchange function as a responsive images solution.

lineitems.name: Susy
lineitems.summary: Sass-driven grid system and my preferred solution. Susy and other pre-processor solutions like it, trump the others on flexibility and control. Provides cleaner and more meaningful HTML markup, as well as an easier method for customising.

lineitems.name: Handlebars
lineitems.summary: Fair experience with templating library and have used commercially. Familiar with general syntax and creating custom helper functions.

lineitems.name: Require.js
lineitems.summary: Good project experience of using library for modular and optmial architecture. Familiar with the r.js optimiser, and AMD substitute almond.js, for building require.js apps for production environments.

lineitems.name: Git Version Control
lineitems.summary: Good knowledge of working with Git via command line. Familiar with Gitflow model - feature branches, release branches, pull requests, hotfixing, etc.

lineitems.name: Grunt
lineitems.summary: I use Grunt to automate a range of tasks such as JavaScript linting, compiling Sass/LESS styles, generating spritesheets, browser auto-reloading, etc. Have recently produced a comprehensive build process for Backbone.js/Require.js apps that compiles to a highly optimised state that I use for projects with such requirements.

lineitems.name: NPM / Bower
lineitems.summary: Very comfortable using either package manager for importing and organising app dependencies and development tools.

lineitems.name: PHP
lineitems.summary: Have often been responsible for the full stack of a website with server-side requirements. Good grasp of Classes, Functions, Scope, Error Handling, etc, as well as working within a PHP framework.

lineitems.name: MySQL
lineitems.summary: Predominantly used MySQL as the database solution for PHP projects. Good level of SQL knowledge. Comfortable managing databases via command line or tools such as Sequel Pro/MySQL Workbench.

lineitems.name: Laravel
lineitems.summary: Good grasp of framework essentials. Competent with writing routes, creating RESTful controllers, views, models, databases, and working with the PHP artisan command line tool. Have also written unit tests with the in-built PHPUnit library.

lineitems.name: CodeIgniter
lineitems.summary: Strong commercial experience as CodeIgniter was a standard where I worked for over two years. Knowledgeable of views, controllers, models, routes, database integration, custom configuration, extending base classes, language translation, etc.
